item.title: Link Finds Ganon's Weakness
item.description: A beep beep here, and beep beep there. Here a beep, there a beep, everywhere a beep beep.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Losing 5 More Games on October 31
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Xbox Game Pass is losing five games on October 31, 2024.
  • The next wave of XGP departures consists of Frog Detective: The Entire Mystery, Headbangers: Rhythm Royale, Inkulinati, Lonely Mountains: Downhill, and Mineko's Night Market.
  • Lonely Mountains: Downhill boasts one of the longest Xbox Game Pass stints out of all third-party titles on the service, as it has been part of its library for half a decade by now.

Xbox Game Pass is losing Headbangers: Rhythm Royale and four other titles on October 31. These upcoming removals will bring the total number of October 2024 Xbox Game Pass departures to 10.

The XGP library typically shrinks every two weeks, in the middle and at the end of every month. This most recently happened on October 15, when Xbox Game Pass lost a handful of titles, including F1 Manager 2023 , Everspace 2 , and the Game Preview version of Dyson Sphere Program .

Another five games will follow suit on October 31, when Microsoft's subscription catalog will lose Frog Detective: The Entire Mystery , Headbangers: Rhythm Royale , Inkulinati , Lonely Mountains: Downhill , and Mineko's Night Market . This is a fairly varied list of titles in terms of time spent on the service, with its two shortest stints belonging to Headbangers: Rhythm Royale and Mineko’s Night Market , both of which reached Xbox Game Pass in October 2023. Meanwhile, Lonely Mountains: Downhill has been part of Microsoft's subscription library since October 2019 and will hence celebrate its fifth anniversary on the service just ahead of its removal.

Xbox Game Pass Games Leaving on October 31, 2024

Game

Platform(s)

Added

OpenCritic Avg.

How Long To Beat

Frog Detective: The Entire Mystery

Cloud, Console, PC

Oct 2022

78

4 hours

Headbangers: Rhythm Royale

Oct 2023

68

3.5 hours

Inkulinati (Game Preview)

Jan 2023

79

8–16.5 hours

Lonely Mountains: Downhill

Oct 2019

81

6–34 hours

Mineko’s Night Market

Oct 2023

68

17–37.5 hours

Aside from having the longest Xbox Game Pass stint, Lonely Mountains: Downhill is also the most critically acclaimed title from this upcoming wave of departures. Specifically, the mountain biking game boasts a "Strong" rating on OpenCritic, derived from an aggregate score of 81 and a 92% reviewer recommendation rate. It also has "Very Positive" user reviews on Steam, based on over 2,200 player impressions. As such, it has been a big boon to the selection of high-quality indie titles on Xbox Game Pass ever since its day-one release on the service. Its sequel, Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders , is currently targeting a late 2024 launch, but it's currently unclear whether it's also planned to reach the XGP library.

As per usual, this upcoming batch of departures was announced alongside the next wave of Xbox Game Pass releases, which includes eight titles in total. The first of those is South Park: The Fractured but Whole , Ubisoft's critically acclaimed RPG that's set to reach the service later today, October 16. MechWarrior 5: Clans and Donut County will then arrive a day later, whereas Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone will debut on October 25.

Ashen and the PC version of Dead Island 2 are scheduled to follow on the 29th and 31st of the month, respectively. The majority of the October 2024 Wave 2 lineup will be exclusively available via PC Game Pass and the Ultimate tier of the service, whereas XGP Standard members will only get access to Donut County , Ashen , and South Park: The Fractured but Whole .

item.title: Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero DLC Wish List
item.description:
After years of anticipation, Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero is finally out, and fans are already enjoying it. The fourth main installment of the Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi series had impressive Steam player numbers before it even came out, and response to its recreation of all things Dragon Ball has been mostly positive so far. Online and offline, there are a lot of things to do in Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero , and plenty of characters to try out in the process. It's a full package that authentically follows up the old fanservice-packed Budokai Tenkaichi games.

Whether players dedicate their time to mastering combat or Custom Battle's intricacies, Sparking Zero should keep many Dragon Ball fans satisfied even after the Dragon Ball Daima anime comes to an end. The fun won't end there, either, as 20 or more characters are confirmed for Sparking Zero ’s first season pass as part of the Super Hero , Daima 1, and Daima 2 packs. More DLC has been rumored beyond that, but there’s more that a Dragon Ball game this diverse could add post-launch than just an endless march of characters and forms.

Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero Could Expand On Its Modes

For as plentiful as Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero ’s content is, there's still room for more. For example, Episode Battle’s various character stories tell Dragon Ball Z and Super 's stories well enough, but there could be character episodes specifically for minor characters like Krillin or Raditz that focus heavily on Sparking Zero 's “what if” scenarios. Custom Battle could be updated with more options and more developer-made Bonus Battles. More customization items and an advanced tutorial section could be added. Even Sparking Zero ’s local versus mode could have more stages enabled for it over time.

New Side Modes In Sparking Zero Would Be Welcome

However, a really impressive addition would be an entirely new mode added on to the existing set. Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2 could be used for inspiration, as it added a Hero Colosseum that merged Xenoverse 2 ’s roster and mechanics with an auto battler. If that's too involved, Sparking Zero has plenty of other options, like a menu-based roguelike dungeon crawl reminiscent of Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy ’s Labyrinth, or chess matches akin to an old Mortal Kombat: Deception mode using characters with altered stats. The sky's the limit for a Dragon Ball game made to please the fans.

Expanded Universe Dragon Ball Characters Deserve A Place On Sparking Zero’s Roster

There's only so much a Dragon Ball game can realistically add without keeping up a flow of new characters, but there are some interesting directions Sparking Zero can go after bringing Budokai Tenkaichi 3 ’s lost fighters back alongside other obvious choices. While Dragon Ball ’s canon roster has developed over the years, non-canon spin-offs have introduced plenty of forms and faces that a Budokai Tenkaichi successor should have access to. Towa, Mira, Fu, Cumber, and all manner of other characters and forms, like Golden Cooler and SSJ4 Vegito, can be found in Dragon Ball Xenoverse , and Dragon Ball Heroes , and more, which Sparking Zero would get a huge pop from adapting.

Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero Could Introduce Its Own Create-A-Character

One other common feature in those side games could migrate over to Sparking Zero , and that is a custom player avatar. First seen in Ultimate Tenkaichi , created characters may seem unnecessary for Sparking Zero at first glance, but Budokai Tenkaichi ’s template approach to character design actually lends itself well to the idea. This would work best as an addition late in Sparking Zero 's life, pushing fans to return to the game and enjoy its other additions. What, besides the new characters, will be worth checking out by that point is hard to say, but Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero shouldn't feel the need to hold back with its DLC.

item.title: Neva - Launch Trailer
item.description: Neva is an emotional action-adventure game centered around the bond between a young woman and her wolf. The game is available now on PC, Nintendo Switch, Xbox, and PlayStation.

item.title: The Best Open-World Switch Games, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Despite perceived lag, the Nintendo Switch offers a variety of thrilling open-world games.
  • Palia, a massive multiplayer cozy title, and Pokemon Scarlet and Violet are recommended open-world games.
  • Expansive titles such as No Man's Sky, Slime Rancher, and The Witcher 3 are available for the Nintendo Switch.

While some players may argue that the Nintendo Switch has lagged behind compared to other consoles, there are still plenty of incredible games players are able to experience on this device; be it in handheld mode or docked to the TV, there is plenty for players to enjoy on the Nintendo Switch.

With a wide variety of genres to enjoy on the platform too, one that many have found themselves getting lost in is the open-world titles. These games give players the freedom to explore large maps and create their own adventures. These are the best open-world games that players can enjoy on the Nintendo Switch right now.

Updated October 16, 2024, by Megan Smith: One of the greatest things about open-world Switch games is that, due to being available on the handheld console, they can also be enjoyed in the open world of real life. This means that players can take these expansive worlds filled with all sorts of thrills while they go on long trips on public transport, or when they simply wish to take their gaming outside on a nice warm day. Even though some of these Nintendo Switch open-world games are incredibly detailed, the battery life of both the regular Nintendo Switch and the Nintendo Switch Lite allow for hours of playtime. With battery in mind, these open-world games are some of the best for purchasing on the Nintendo Switch.

18 Palia

A Massive Multiplayer Cozy Title

Palia is a massively multiplayer title that has an incredibly large world for the player to explore. As a simulation title, this open world is unlike many others on the list as players are free to explore Palia however they see fit. It's quite a surprise to find such a great experience that works so well on the Nintendo Switch, but this MMO is truly one of the greatest, as players can explore this phenomenal open world with other Nintendo Switch users.

An open world is only made greater by its activities and Palia has lots of them, from insect catching, cooking, hunting, and much more to make Palia one of the best open-world games that has recently been added to the Nintendo Switch.

17 Pokemon Scarlet and Violet

A Pokemon Adventure Where Players Are Free To Explore

Nintendo itself has created a few open-world titles that can be enjoyed on its console. One such example is the 2022 release of the ninth generation of the Pokemon franchise.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet really leaned into the open-world aspect of Pokemon in this title as players were left to explore Paldea freely as they had to adventure across the map to find the different gyms to battle, not to forget mentioning the other tasks available to the player in this version of the game.

16 No Man's Sky

Explore The Entirity Of Space And Its Planets

Many players are likely to be surprised to hear that the open-world sic-if adventure of No Man's Sky can be enjoyed on the Nintendo Switch. However, even with this surprise, players are in for an incredible survival adventure as they fly to various planets in the galaxy.

With the galaxy at their fingertips, the player is free to either follow the story of No Man's Sky or simply spend their time exploring the stars, with this being available on a handheld console is an incredible experience for any player on the Nintendo Switch.

15 Slime Rancher

Run A Ranch For Slimes On A Slime-Filled Island

Slime Rancher is an incredible open-world game that can be enjoyed on the Nintendo Switch. Players can find and combine different slimes to collect plorts that can then be used to earn them extra gold. With an interesting storyline to discover while exploring the island, Slime Rancher can make for an intriguing little adventure.

As this version of the game has been specifically made for the Nintendo Switch, this also means that the simulator title runs perfectly on the small device.

14 Lego City Undercover

A Whole World Created From Lego

Open-world Switch games come in an assortment of styles, and a variety of Lego games have also been released onto the Nintendo Switch. One of the most promising games that many players on the Switch have praised is Lego City Undercover. This open-world Lego game sees the player take on the role of a police officer inside Lego City as he hunts down an escaped crime boss.

Players are free to explore the entire city as Chase McCain, making the most of all sorts of fashionable Lego vehicles to chase after the various criminals of Lego City. As the game was originally exclusive to the Nintendo Switch, exploring this open world will reveal all sorts of Nintendo Easter eggs for the player to uncover too.

13 Red Dead Redemption

Enjoy A Chunk Of The Wild West On The Nintendo Switch

Red Dead Redemption was originally released on PS3 and the Xbox 360 in 2010. However, as of 2023, this classic Wild West tale has made its way onto the Nintendo Switch. Players can finally control John Marston as he lives the life of a cowboy in a world that is drastically changing.

Even when using the Nintendo Switch in handheld mode, Red Dead Redemption remains a steadfast open-world game that players can now enjoy no matter where they go. Besides this, the game also includes Undead Nightmare , which allows players to enjoy the supernatural version of the title.

12 Immortals Fenyx Rising

A World Based On Greek Mythology

Immortals Fenyx Rising is another great open-world game that can be enjoyed on the Nintendo Switch. Made by the same team that created Assassin's Creed Odyssey, Immortals Fenyx Rising has an interesting art style as well as an incredible world to explore filled with story and puzzles.

This vibrant world is only made better through players being able to even enjoy it on a smaller screen like the Switch. The open world of Immortals Fenyx Rising is only made better through being able to explore it with the wings of Fenyx themselves.

11 Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

A Classic ARPG Adventure In An Expansive World

Even though Dragon's Dogma 2 was released in March 2024, many players continue to explore Dragon's Dogma lore by playing the previous titles of the franchise. One of the greatest RPGs made by Capcom can even be enjoyed on the Nintendo Switch, with many enjoying Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen .

To many fans' surprise, the port of Dragon's Dogma works great on the Nintendo Switch. Even with how large the map is, and how intense some battles can be in this open-world RPG, players will not be disappointed if they decide to start their adventure on the Switch.

10 Don't Starve

Survive On A Large Randomly Generated Map

Don't Starve is an open-world survival game where the main goal of the game is to not starve to death. Besides starving, players will have plenty of other goals, such as preparing for the winter months, fighting off wolves, and remaining sane while the darkness creeps closer.

Players may set up their base in one place, but to find all the resources they need, they will have to adventure across the randomly generated world to find what they are truly after. This combined with the interesting Gothic art style of Don't Starve makes the survival title the perfect sort of game to enjoy while playing the Nintendo Switch handheld.

9 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Explore Skyrim And Take On Dragons

Skyrim is a classic RPG that has seen itself ported onto various different consoles and platforms over the years. This has meant that, eventually, the game even made it to the Nintendo Switch, where it has surprisingly done pretty well, especially as the version available contains all the DLC along with it.

Players can easily explore the world of Skyrim either on the handheld or docked into their TV to experience the intense dragon battles or epic adventures on the big screen. With the capability to take this open world anywhere on the Nintendo Switch, it's a must for any player looking for an open world to explore.

8 Subnautica

Even Swimming Underwater Can Be An Open World To Explore

Even vast oceans and underwater depths can be experienced with the Switch. Subnautica is an unbelievable survival game that has players attempting to live on an alien planet covered in water. With various horrific monsters deep below the surface, Subnautica can be an intense experience.

Unsurprisingly, as Subnautica has made its way to a variety of platforms, even those who own a Nintendo Switch can take the plunge and survive on an alien world with its own fascinating story. Although the ocean may initially appear empty, there is plenty to discover in Subnautica .

7 Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag

Take To The Seas As An Assassin

Red Dead Redemption isn't the only well known franchise to make its way onto the Nintendo Switch. Other popular open-world franchises like Assassin's Creed have also released various titles onto the handheld platform.

One of the greatest open worlds that players can explore is Ubisoft's Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag. It not only offers exploration on land, but also allows players to go out on incredible pirate adventures across the sea. This open world is only made more enticing due to all the activities a player can take part in, from deep sea diving to hunting for sharks, which are likely to distract any player from the main story.

6 Spiritfarer

Travel Between Islands And Help Spirits Passover

Players who are looking for an emotional adventure while also being able to sail across another open world need to look no further than Spiritfarer . In this title, players take on the role of Stella, a ferry master for the departed; through exploring various islands in a beautifully drawn art style, players must help these spirits get over past issues, so they can finally pass over.

With various islands to explore across an even wider ocean, there is plenty to discover than just the spirits players will likely help. The art style and cozy nature of this game all help it become a perfect open-world title for players to enjoy on the Switch.

5 A Short Hike

Freely Climb A Mountain And Make Friends Along The Way

A Short Hike is a phenomenal Nintendo Switch open-world game in which players are free to explore a mountain and meet all the other fellow hikers during their adventure. With the main goal to make it to the very top of this mountain in A Short Hike , the title is perfect for the handheld. It doesn't feel short at all when the player is constantly getting distracted by plenty of other activities.

In addition to having a great open world to explore, A Short Hike is also a brilliant, cozy title for players to enjoy while relaxing. The player doesn't need to worry about the dangers of bears or wolves. Every creature is waiting to be the player's friend, and falling isn't a risk either when the player is a bird.

4 Xenoblade Chronicles 3

A Nintendo Classic With An incredible World To Explore

The Xenoblade Chronicles is a well-received Nintendo franchise that has continued to be successful even on the Nintendo Switch, with Xenoblade Chronicles 3 being one of the most-loved action RPGs to be put on the platform.

Xenoblade Chronicles 3 is another Nintendo Switch title that has surprised players with how detailed the open world of the game is, especially as this map is one of the largest in the series to date. Besides how beautiful the world is, Xenoblade Chronicles 3 also has a phenomenal story that players have revisited ever since it was first released in 2022.

3 Minecraft

An Open-World Sandbox Survival With Plenty In Store

Minecraft is a sandbox open-world title that has seen itself spread to almost every platform in existence, from past generations of consoles to the current ones. The Nintendo Switch is no different, as Minecraft has even graced this console with players either playing it handheld or when docked.

This sandbox title has one of the largest maps; this not only includes how large it is to walk across the land and visit the different biomes but also how deep underground one can explore as well as the Nether and the End.

2 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Ride On The Back Of Roach Killing Monsters

CD Projekt Red is known to make plenty of incredible RPGs, but one of the greatest that can also be enjoyed on the Nintendo Switch is The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt .

This game not only has an expansive open world that is so large it needs to be split into separate sections, but also a variety of monsters for the player to defeat to make them feel like the incredible monster hunter that Geralt is. With a horse available to explore the world, players are encouraged to explore, even on the Nintendo Switch.

1 The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

The Classic Zelda Franchise In An Open World

By far, the greatest open-world game that can be played on the Nintendo Switch has to be the exclusive Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom . Before this was Breath of the Wild which amazed players allowing them to explore the entirety of Hyrule and complete various quests for the people around it.

Tears of the Kingdom are this and so much more, as players are now free to explore deep below the surface and high above the clouds. Still free to do whatever they wish with even more powers for them to play around with, makes the Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom a must for any with a Nintendo Switch.
